description: Learned borrowing from Old English ġemōt (“meeting, council, moot, encounter”).

entries.meaning: (historical) A (legislative or judicial) assembly in Anglo-Saxon England.
examples: a.d. 978. — In this year was held the celebrated gemot at Calne in Wiltshire, when the floor gave way  […]
I have spoken to Veedron, a member of one of Trellisane's many gemots, or ruling councils.
